line.en: She said that, then she hung her bag over her\nshoulder.
'Wait!'
The thoughts that I was desperately holding\ninside started to overflow, and in that moment, I\ntried to keep them in check.
Amane was really going to leave.
She was going to leave her dreams, her memories,\neverything, behind.
I don't want to let her go... My heart trembled\nwith such strong feelings.
She puts down her bag and turns towards me.
'Aoi?'
I walk over to her, then take her hand.
I press my lips against hers.
'Mmph...'
Amane is surprised, and her whole body tenses up.
She looks like she doesn't understand what's\nhappening, and her eyes are open in bewilderment.
'Mmmmmph...'
But that was only to begin with.
Once she grasped the situation, the tension\ndisappeared from her rigid shoulders.
Amane closed her eyes, and then, entrusting\nherself to me, pressed her lips back against\nmine.
'Mmm... mmmm...'
Her lips were lush, soft and delicate.
There was a certain elasticity to them and they\npushed back against my lips.
The feelings of sadness turned to feelings of\nadoration.
I pulled her hand towards me, and pressed my lips\nmore strongly against hers.
'Mmmmmph...'
Amane didn't refuse it, she accepted.
The lushness of her lips spread to every corner\nof my thoughts.
This was a pleasant sensation that I had never\nexperienced before.
Then, we slowly moved our lips away.
It lingered for a moment, then the warmth from\nthe two of us being so close soon disappeared.
'Aoi, this is the sort of thing that you do with\nthe person that you like...'
'...I like you, Amane.'
'Not just as my senpai, but as a girl.'
'I don't wanna let you go.'
Amane looks at me with a troubled look on her\nface.
'...I can't stay here.'
'I know. That's why... I at least wanted to let\nyou know how I feel.'
Amane was going to leave... When I thought of\nthat, I couldn't bear it, and before I realized,\nI had kissed her.
'...Yes, I understand.'
Amane nodded with a kind smile on her face.
Then, reluctantly, I let go of her hand.
'Thank you, Aoi. Up until the very end, I was\nable to have many wonderful memories.'
She smiles happily and then puts her bag on her\nshoulder.
'Amane.'
I withdraw my hand which was held out.
'Can I walk you to the bus stop?'
'Sure.'
Then, after many years here, Amane left the\ngarage.
She had no more regrets.
With that, our short summer together was over.
